body.p: All of us developers have been reeling from the sudden, rapid growth of our userbase and are scrambling to catch up, but we've also been having a lot of fun :) Thankfully, we now have some new infrastructure in place to help support our new users, the most notable of which are the new, super-slick Gentoo Linux discussion forums at http://forums.gentoo.org. Many thanks to Kyle for taking the initiative to set them up -- they're awesome.

In addition to the forums, we now have an alt.os.linux.gentoo newsgroup, several new mailing lists and new #gentoo-user and #gentooppc IRC channels. Yes, you heard me right -- thanks to some skilled and motivated PPC guys (pvdabeel and kain, to be exact) there now exists Gentoo Linux for the PowerPC! It's now possible to run Gentoo Linux/PPC on Apple PowerBooks and other PowerPC-based machines. As time goes on, we'll be adding Gentoo Linux/PPC-related resources to our site, as well as info on the forthcoming Sparc and Sparc64 ports of Gentoo Linux. The second half of 2002 promises to be a very interesting time for Gentoo Linux. Stay tuned...
